reviews.sentence: Gorgeous bathrooms great views amazing concierge lounge. This was a trip playing tourist over New Years 20142015. I stayed in a Club Level room 2 floors down from the top. The room was very clean very well appointed albeit not very large. However the bathroom was just perfect. Giant tiled walk in shower with frameles glass doors and two shower heads one removable. Plus a separate tub and a very nice sink vanity. Having that beautiful giant shower to refresh in after walking around San Francisco was quite nice. The Concierge Lounge and high level view were absolutely worth spending the extra for the room. The breakfast in the morning itself was quite good better than many small hotels breakfast buffet. I ate there every morning which saved quite a bit from breakfast in the lobby restaurant. A couple different kinds of eggs several hot meats oatmeal cheeses yogurt coffee it was quite nice. Plus I made some new friends chatting with other folks staying there. This hotel is a little unusual in that there is not really much of a lobby area where people sit and work or have drinks socialize etc. it is small and the traffic through is so much that it is more of waiting area than a social lobby. If you enjoy that hotel lobby place to meet new people work etc then this will not be a good fit unles you have access to the concierge lounge. Location is decent for visiting the city but you will walk a little and use public transportation. Two short blocks like literally 5 minutes walk from Market 5th where you can catch any number of buses or streetcars. If you are going to a convention at Moscone it will be perfectly located. It was not cheap but no hotels in the city in SF are. Valet parking is hideously expensive though this is true of all hotels in the city. There is a public garage right behind the hotel at about half the nightly rate which is still pricey. Overall I loved the hotel though next time I might opt for a junior suite for a little more space though I will not want to give up access to the concierge lounge.

Best hotel for giants fans. Hands down one of the better hotel for its price. Super clean rooms with friendly staff and valet parking. Only down side is that they charge you for using the business center.

High expectations disapointing experience. Very good service in the restaurant. Good concierge service. Very clean room nice bathrobes and comfortable slippers. Poor check in service. My reservation was for deluxe room with two queen beds. First we have been given the smallest room in the hotel with one single queen bed and had to argue with the front desk to get our reserved room type. Hotel staff was checking room numbers and guest names at the lobby elevator. Unfriendly and very expensive valet parking.

An excellent SF Hotel. This was a business trip and the second time staying at the Intercontinental SF. Once again it was an excellent stay. The check in was efficient and friendly and the the room was comfortable and well set up. Concierge is excellent to help find our way around and every staff member had a cheery welcome. The hotel is sort of on the edge of the central business district being two blocks from Market St but it is an easy 10 minute walk to the big Westfield Union Square and the main shopping areas. There are also some beaut bars and places to eat in the adjoining blocks. ATT Park is walking distance and BART bus and streetcar to the pier 10 minutes 225 each exact change or buy a clipper card is in Market St The Moscone Exhibition Centre is right next door. Free fast Wifi for IHC Club members otherwise it is a bit expensive.
The viewI was charged for items not consumed from the mini bar. The staff was very helpful removing the charge when called.

Not disappointing not surprising. I love intercontinental hotels and choose to stay at them as often as I can. This was average a bit out dated. Service was nice as expected the gym was good not great. The beds really were not comfortable and that was my main problem.
Great location. Very modern hotel attentive staff and fantastic room view from the 30th floor. Got bumped up as well for being an IHG member.

bathroom door does not lock. The hotel is ok but not great. No fan in the bathroom so you have to turn the shower on to produce a masking noise and door does not lock it does not even close tightly. For an over 250 a night that is kind of disappointing. Spa is nothing special just one small steam room a dirty jacuzi and a coldish pool. 20 dollars. Breakfast buffet is 30 food quality good. Dinner was also excellent especially the service. The view from the room was impressive. Location. It took more than an hour to reach this place from the Legion of Honour museum at 5 pm very frustrating traffic and scary streets on the way.

Clean Centrally Located Comfortable Rooms. I have stayed at this property on more than and a handful of times and enjoy it is central location in San Francisco. Some of my favorite touches include the outdoor mezzanine off the indoor pool and fitness center the super comfy beds with GREAT views of San Francisco easy valet parking although expensive. in room USB charging wherever you look. The current population of homeless folks in San Francisco unfortunately tend to gather just past the block that the Intercontinental corners. For a seasoned city person this not might be much of a point you notice however for guests that are not accustomed to life in a big city it could be a bit up close and personal. The shampoo that the hotel provides is actually really good and it is one of the little things that make a big difference when traveling for business as frequently as I do. The staff is always great and the front desk operates as any front desk at a four star major brand name hotel should. During one of my stays the phone system was down for some reason or another and I unfortunately had to wait over an hour for a simple housekeeping request. Service is consistently good as expected with the price tags their rooms carry. My travel status with IHG has awarded me upgraded rooms on several occasions and I always enjoy taking in the views regardless of what side of the hotel I have been on. Sunrises sunsets are always a treat in San Francisco. Will definitely stay here again as it is a perfect location for our SF travel and event operations.
Exceptional. Staff in hotel bar was incredibly friendly. Room was very clean.

no customer service. While the hotel was excellent the service and the room was not. We booked a Quen size bed for my wife and I and they gave me the smallest room with a full size bed. When I complained they just shrugged it off and did absolutely nothing about it. They insisted that was the reservation we had booked. upon checkout I complained once again and they did nothing about it. They repeated the company line about the type of booking we made. We showed them the reservation and still nothing. We wo nt be staying there any more.

Old building dusty rooms unprepared staff but very good room service. So we stayed 3 night in this hotel which seems to be being very old it must have been a truly beauty back in the days. Alas now the rooms are dusty we had to change room when we check ed in. The furniture should be refurbished and also may I suggest a good training to the staff as we asked several times the same question about one free drink included the employee rate and we never ever received a satisfactory answer. We ordered room service 2 times in a row and we gladly enjoyed it. Also please be extra careful with your guest at check out it is not acceptable to spend more than 20min for a check out when you decide to pay cash.
Not a good experience the sum of the parts are broken from concierge info to location to front desk to restaurant.

This was maybe the single best experience I have ever had at a hotel. The service is first class and they won me over in the first 10 minutes. I relocated to the hotel during the PG E power outage and the staff made me feel at home. This is an amazing hotel.

Good for Business not for Personal Travel. I had to stay at the intercontinental for a business trip and decided to continue my stay at the intercontinental for a long weekend after to explore the city. While the location is great for business especially if you are visiting the convention center or any of the tech companies in the area I would not recommend this hotel for a personal trip. This was my first time visiting SF so I was not sure where to stay. I figured it would be like any metropolitan city easy transportation to all of the touristy sites. However I quickly realized that due to the hotels proximity to the Tenderloin neighborhood and Sixth Street the homeless problem made it unsafe to venture out at night and taking a car service at night was practically required. I am a female and was traveling alone but I have lived in NYC my entire life and never have felt as unsafe as I did walking around this neighborhood even during the day. The first night I got there. I asked the bellhop for the nearest convenience store and he suggested I wait till morning to leave the hotel as it would not be safe to walk to thankful for this bellhops honest advice. This review is not a reflection on the intercontinental hotel itself but rather the neighborhood. The hotel itself was great and what you would expect from an intercontinental. The check in staff were phenomenal and offered me an upgrade to a higher floor and late checkout. The bellhops were extremely helpful helping me with bags giving me directions etc. The rooms were clean and I loved the floor to ceiling windows offering panoramic views. I did not get a chance to eat at the restaurant but did visit the bar and the bartenders were all attentive and pleasant.

Great location. The overall experience was good. The cleaning staff forgot to replace the sugar and creamer for coffee. The door to the ice machine was jammed and we had to call the front desk to have them open it. I would definitely stay there again.

Good 4 Hotel. Not sure if this hotel is an official 4 or 5 star rated hotel however I ’d say it definitely falls in to a very good 4 standard. Whilst our stay was comfortable and enjoyable I would n’t say we were blown away. Valet parking is very expensive here however it ’s convenient and a captive market in a central location so to be expected. One of the glasses in our room was chipped caught my lip with it when I discovered it. Luckily did n’t cause any harm but a hotel of this standard really should n’t allow something like that to slip through. A friend reserved our rooms on arrival asked for my room to be updated to my details with my Gold IHG membership details and again this was not done. Not sure why IHG properties in the USA appear to be unable to complete this without issues. Not a complaint as the team were all very professional and pleasant just their systems appear to struggle with the task. Will follow up when I return home. Overall a good stay and would recommend.
Great hotel but baggage service prices need to be adjusted.

Great stay. I stayed here for two nights. I was given an upgrade and higher floor and I had amazing view. The room was spacious and well decorated. Cleanness was good. I used shoe shine service and laundry service and I was very happy with the service. Breakfast was adequate though I had expected a bit more variety however it is one of the best stays. I liked that fact that you can pick up a bottle at reception and use the filtered water dispenser to fill up.

Breakfast not worth the money. Beautifully maintained hotel. The breakfast buffet was not worth the 320. We usually stay across the bay at Club Renaissance and the breakfast is fantastic. Also waited too long for beverage refill so service staff was adequate although polite. Hotel and rooms were beautiful.

Not a true luxury hotel. Reservation via Hotelscom specifying two queen beds for a family of four. Arrived early on flight from EST. Front desk agent was barely polite pointing out the bell stand to store bags. Not allowed to check in. Told to come back later. Finally given room with two double beds. 19 yo son slept on floor. At least the rooms are clean. The whole place is faded compared to previous stays years ago. At more than 400 a night even for a tiny room would expect more solicitous service and desire to help. Will not repeat.

InterCon 4Star Quality Hotel. We booked this hotel for our anniversary trip and I think it was a good choice. It was my first time in San Francisco and I was shocked with the great number of homeless people around — the hotel area was not spared. The shopping district downtown can be accessed by foot from this hotel so it was really convenient. Cabs here are few and not good. Uber also seem to be not that easy to get too — very frustrating. Frontdesk staffs were just okay but subpar compared to other five star hotels I ’ve been atand other Intercons I ’ve stayed inI commend the management for the effort of making the stay special by preparing the wineeven though I do n’t drink — this special touch makes any person ’s heart really warm. Pros. Good locationClean romComfortable bed and pilowsBasic toiletry suplyCons Small romSan Fran standardUnatentive frontdesk and cleaning staff s housekeeping failed to clean our room in spite of the reminders we gaveAs a whole I would give this a 375 star rate if. I could so I ’l just give it ‘ 4 stars that needs improvement ‘ would be my score for this place. I can give it another try once I visit San Francisco again.
